info.title: V4_internal (Test)
info.description:
# V4 internal, intended for internal applications, like marketplace, data workbench, etc.

## Features and use cases.

### 1. Marketplace

Allows the marketplase to lookup existing tenants and create new ones. Can allso install and uninstall applications on exixting tenants.

### 2. Data Workbench

Allow the data workbench to create new users and assign data workbench licenses to them. Also allows to assign the new users admin roles when needed.

### 3. invoicing systems

Allows the invoicing system to look up orders and find usage metrics for the orders to use as basis for invoicing.


> Service build version __BUILD_NUMBER__ - Environment: Test

post.description: Install an applications in an existing tenant. Request with server sent events. The application admin user must already be a member of the tenant. The application admin will not be able to invite users to the tenant if this right is not already granted.

202.description: The request has been accepted for processing, but the processing has not been completed.

email.description: This is the email address of the user who will be the administrator of the tenant. Cannot be specified if UserId is set

userId.description: Required: The userId from id.veracity.com, cannot be specified if Email is set. only available if the user already exists in the Veracity

applicationId.description: This is the application id found in developer as serviceId, it is the invariant id of the application across all tenants.

orderNumber.description: The order number associated with the application installed in the tenant.

quantity.description: The number of licenses purchased for the application.

pricingTier.description: Represents the pricing tier, sku or variant of the application installed in the tenant. usually provided by the marketplace.

adminUserId.description: Optional: the user id from Veracity Identity that will be the admin of the application in the tenant. Used when the user isn't already a tenant admin. The user must be a member of the tenant.

hasAccessLevel.description: Determines if the capability can have additional rights associated with it. If true, the capability is visible in access hub and is part of ACL.

capacityUnit.description: This is usually used to tell the application what the unit of measure is for the capacity. Eg gigabytes, number of sub-elements, etc.

admins.description: List of the initial administrators for the tenant

applications.description: the list of applications that should be installed in the tenant

domains.description: list of email domains that is associated with the tenant. Only available for tenants with the tenant type veracity_default

legalEntityName.description: The name of the legal entity, should be the same as the name of the tenant. And is synced with the legal entity (site) in MDM.

legalEntityId.description: The internal MDM id for the legal entity

description.description: Describe the purpose og the element

elementExternalId.description: the application's reference for the element. This is the same as the element id in the application.

elementType.description: the type of the element, used to describe the element in the application.

capabilities.description: Additional capabilities enabled for the application element.

name.description: The name of the element. This is used to display the element in the application and access hub.

systemTags.description: The system tags associated with the element and assigned by the application itself or Veracity Platform components. These are used to categorize and filter elements in the application and access hub.

properties.description: The extension properties. Extra information kept on the object.

ElementRequest.description: Represents a request to create an application element.

elementId.description: The ID of the application element.

applicationInstanceId.description: The globally unique identifier (GUID) for the application.

ElementResponse.description: This class represents the response for an application element.

name.description: The name of the property. Properties are case sensitive and shall use {appPrefix}_{propertyName} format, appPrefixes are defined in developer.veracity.com.

applicationId.description: The ID of the application. This is the same as the serviceId in developer.

accessLevel.description: Indicates the accessLevel of the uses in the application instance, only applicable for applications with tenant wide roles. eg:  'owner', 'contributor', 'reader'.

canAddUsersToTenant.description: indicates that the user needs to be able to add users to the tenant (grant the user UserAdmin rights on the tenant), cannot be set to true without isApplicationAdmin being set to true. If the user is already a UserAdmin setting it to false will not remove this right

isApplicationAdmin.description: indicates that the user needs to be able to administer the application (grant the user ApplicationAdmin rights on the application)

Metadata.description: Represents the metadata information for the entities.

Operation.description: An operation to perform against a resource property. eg update the 'name' property of a resource

applications.description: The applications to remove from the tenant.
The applications that were uninstalled has both the key and the value filled out.

userId.description: the user id from Veracity Identity, cannot be specified together with email

profileId.description: the object id of the user in the tenant.
